name: (2E)-2-phenyl-3-(phenylamino)prop-2-enenitrile
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-925
Reason: The compound (2E)-2-phenyl-3-(phenylamino)prop-2-enenitrile has a base structure of a prop-2-enenitrile group, which has a melting point of approximately -20°C. The phenylamino group attached to the alpha carbon adds a further +60°C due to its increased molecular weight and pi-pi stacking interactions. The phenyl group adds an additional +60°C due to its increased molecular weight and pi-pi stacking interactions. The total estimated impact on the melting point from all functional groups is: -20 (base) + 60 (phenylamino group) + 60 (phenyl group) = 140°C.
